reviewText: The show was fantastic; I saw her live in Abu Dhabi last year and was blown away. Although I must admit that the editing was overdone it kind of steals the artistry that was showcased during the live concert with wrong angles at times that dont seem to be in place, or camera not focusing on Madonna when it should have. Nevertheless, this is a great collection for fans to have as I personally think that the MDNA tour is Madonna's second best tour after Blond Ambition.
summary: Madonna, still the reigning queen of pop.
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: The MDNA Tour (gotta keep it hip and current right) was a spectacle to witness live and in person.  Unfortunately, listening to it isn't quite as rewarding.  My complaints do not come from the song selection or the show itself--the mixing on this "album" is just terrible.  Back in the day, I used to hold my cassette recorder up to the TV to make cassettes of some of my favorite Madonna performances...and this release sounds like Madonna did exactly that.  It's essentially the DVD--with all it's added vocals, sound-effects, and intros and outros--released as an album.  The sound is muffed and, when played loudly, muddles together into a bass thumpin' mash.  A very poor quality product from the usually exceptional Madonna!
summary: Retro Sound?  Yeah, in the days of cassettes and VHS...
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: The quality of the image in this blu ray is awful, so grainy, with picture noise. The audio , the same problem with the 5.1.The editing is so so , weird! There are more angles of the audience than madonna. And the quick change of angles, make me dizzy .I want my money back Madonna ?

reviewText: My wife and I are huge Madonna fans but this release is not as good as her Sticky and Sweet Blu-ray concert, sorry. The artistic achievement of the Buenos Aries show will remain her peak moment, arguably the highest moment in culture in 2009 and since.The audio is not right either, I want a refund.
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: I almost hate to be that annoying guy who comes on here and smugly proclaims "Everything worked fine for me!" but the truth is, this Blu-Ray really did work just fine for me, lol. In fact, anticipating the horror to come after reading so many bad reviews, I actually bought the DVD version as well, and now that I've had to chance compare them both firsthand, I must say that  the Blu-Ray really does put the DVD to shame in nearly every way. (Well, maybe not every way. The disc menu is a total nightmare to navigate and it took maybe a minute of random button pushing just to get the thing to play at all, but once it did, we were kosher.) Now, I don't know a thing about surround sound or fancy speakers or anything like that, but as far as just popping the disc into a standard player with standard settings, everything looked and sounded wonderful. True, there's a good amount of grain that's noticeable when the image is predominately dark, mostly with audience shots, but that's pretty par for the course with Blu-Rays today, and when focusing on the stage and Madonna herself, the colors are bright and vibrant and crisp. At times the audio also sounds "off," like perhaps it was re-dubbed post-production, but I'm inclined to say that's due more in part to poor editing choices than actual technical defects. At least it was clear. Now I'm not saying that the other 95% of the people complaining here are mistaken in their concerns, since obviously enough people experienced legitimate problems to warrant an official recall of this product, but who knows, maybe I just got lucky.In regards to the concert itself, it's just phenomenal. I'm a lifelong admirer of Madonna - with the tattoo to prove it, lol - but have also learned to look at her with a more objective and critical eye in recent years. The Hard Candy album was an embarrassing, awful mess on every level, and MDNA was a mixed bag to say the least. (The songs that are good are REALLY good, but the songs that are bad are REALLY bad.) The subsequent MDNA tour, however, proved once again that in spite of her waning musical inspirations, she is still unmatched as a live performer and you can't help but be left breathless. In fact, I even left the show with a newfound appreciation for some songs that up until that point I only considered filler, such as I'm a Sinner and Turn Up the Radio. Most of the "Madonna classics" such as Vogue and Express Yourself are played straight, as opposed to the Sticky and Sweet Tour where everything was remixed beyond recognition, which I admit was a nice change this time around. Like a Virgin was slowed way down, and in conjunction with the nearly acapella Love Spent, made for the most poignant segment of the night - although I absolutely hate the way that part was edited for home release. (Still photos? Really?) In fact you'll probably find the editing in general to be a bit jarring at first; I don't think any single camera shot lingers for more than one or two seconds at a time. It's definitely a fast-paced flurry of images that perhaps tries a bit too hard to be stylish, and the "feels like I'm there" concept is totally tossed out the window, but it's a fun ride while it lasts and you'll still appreciate the fact that when it comes to live performances, even after all these years, Madonna truly invests everything she's got and doesn't settle for anything less than epic.
summary: The Blu-Ray works great for me (and the concert itself is phenomenal)
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: Madonna's MDNA Tour is really good. My copy I bought the DVD version played perfectly. Her song choices were well chosen. It looks like the dvd is currently out of print. If your an fan of Madge this is an must have for you DVD collection.

Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: "Grainy", "poor quality", "VHS quality" "bad sound", etc: These are just some of the descriptions of the MDNA Tour concert Blu-Ray from Madonna. My copy arrived today. My reaction: First, there are three audio tracks; the first is an HD-Audio that is supposed to be 5.1 surround sound. It is NOT. In fact it sounds like both the front and real channels are missing on one side. Again, the front left and the rear left are completely SILENT. However, select AUDIO TRACK 2, and you get a GREAT sounding 2-channel stereo, that will break up into a surround environment. It sounds wonderful; as good as any concert that I've heard in 2.0 and the surround information is vibrant and exciting. As for the VIDEO, honestly I don't know what some of these comments are all about! The concert is VERY colorful and appears to be utilizing various filters for a more FILMIC effect. In fact this entire concert looks like a FILM, and that is a very good thing. I didn't find any of this to look "grainy" and the very notion that it looks "washed out" or like "VHS" is just ludicrous. Although I wish there was a proper HD 5.1 audio option, I am very happy with the audio and video on this Blu-Ray. Perhaps my copy is corrected from what others have seen, but since my sound is defective as well, I dare-say that I have received and now seen, exactly what veryone else has seen. As for the concert itself, here are some one-word adjectives: "UNBELIEVABLE!" "STUNNING" "INTENSE" "BEAUTIFUL" and finally, a more 'complete' reaction: The MDNA tour is ferocious, fearless and mind-blowing throughout! The visuals are absolutely wild. MDNA is like a blend of "Cirque Du Soleil" and Dante's Inferno. Madonna continues to amaze, giving new meaning behind the statement that some people don't get older - they get BETTER! Prepare to be knocked off your feet by MDNA!
summary: I've just watched the Blu-Ray and now for an honest review
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: i couldn't agree with the other review more. it is a straight audio rip from the Epix version and i'm assuming the 2.0 stereo track that would be on the dvd/blu-ray (not sure, i haven't gone to buy the blu-ray yet). whoever mixed this should be fired. it really does sound bootlegged... her voice is way too loud and the actual music is drowned out by the screaming and yelling of the audience 95% of the time.all her other live cd tour releases have sounded great and have been edited and mixed properly... this is a huge disappointment.the cd-r note is also rather odd, and the fact that it's not sold in stores.the blu-ray BETTER sound wayyyy better than this or i'm gonna be one unhappy Madonna fan :/Just got the 2cd set from Amazon... it's the exact same thing as the digital download from iTunes or if you bought it here. basically just the 2.0 soundtrack directly from the dvd/bluray. again, not the best audio mixing... but i knew what i was getting since i DLed it on the 10th from iTunes. i could've saved myself $15 and just burned it myself on 2 cds... however as a collector i wanted a psychical copy. packaging looks like an official release. includes the booklet and the cds have a black top with writing like the dvd/bluray. i cant complain about the audio cd edition cuz i knew exactly what i was getting.

reviewText: From Interscope Records:Interscope Records would like to make consumers of Madonna's MDNA World Tour Blu-ray disc aware that the concert will be seen at its most optimal quality by properly adjusting the settings on your television to "Normal/Movie" mode rather than "Dynamic/Enhanced" mode.Older Blu-ray players or those without a firmware upgrade may experience glitches when navigating the Blu-ray menu. Follow the manufacturer's instructions to upgrade firmware.Due to an error in manufacturing that has compromised the 5.1 audio in the US, a full recall of the Blu-ray disc will be issued in the US. No other markets will be affected.We apologize for this inconvenience.
summary: Apology From Interscope Records RE: Blu-ray
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: I read one review warning about the Bluray of the show being of very poor picture quality. Mine is terrible. It looks like a bad cellphone recording. I heard the DVD isn't like this so I am gonna try that route.I love the show. The editing is fine. I'd rather see the show as it was performed without the restructuring of editing, but that isn't the way it is done.The sound on my Bluray is also not in complete stereo.I am returning the Bluray and trying the DVD. I think the many positive reviews of the Bluray were written before those folks saw it. It was only released today. They are giving positive reviews to the awesomeness of the show and Madonna. I agree the show is awesome and so is my girl; but this product is a disaster. At least my copy and apparently others.UPDATE: 9/12/13 I have the DVD now. It is of much better picture quality than the Bluray; but it is still not good video. I don't know if it is the way it was filmed or the way they produced the DVDs and Blurays, but video quality is not doing the show any favors. As for the sound, it is not complete stereo. I have awesome equipment and you cannot get loud concert sound out of either the Bluray or DVD. No Bass to be had on my DVD or Bluray.I have sent the Bluray back and received the refund. I'll keep the DVD as it is better than nothing. I'll hope for a better release. With all of the negative feedback who knows what might happen.Now I'll buy the audio CDs and see if they sound right. LMAO Long live the Queen!
summary: my Bluray version is a bust
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: I could live with the picture quality (even though there is grain, and lots of it), but the quality of the audio almost makes this DVD unwatchable. It sounds really bad. This is a big slap in the face to fans who have waited all this time to buy this DVD/Blu-Ray. I hope they start offering replacement copies fast.
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: 30 years into her illustrious career, there's nothing much else to say or prove. Watch the MDNA Tour on Blu-Ray (my copy is perfectly fine, image or audio-wise) and you will know the kind of showmanship that this one-woman wonder is associated with. Once on the stage whether belting out old tunes or new, the stage is hers. While others often say people only pay to watch Madonna perform her old hits, I beg to differ. Madonna's catalog is so vast that a 2-hour show will not be able to accommodate but she expertly weaves in elements of old songs into her new songs and the majority of MDNA is sung here. Look carefully - her fans are able to sing her new songs, which have an added dynamism live, too. There's no doubt this woman sings live too - watch Like a Virgin Waltz and Like A Prayer where she borrows the voices of her fans on many lines. Last but not least, I am utterly amazed at the energy this woman possesses and how she contorts her body almost like a seasoned gymnast to perform! If any of today's female artistes can take their careers this far, they can take away her throne. In the meantime, Madonna is QUEEN!
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: I am in love with Madonna, and have been since the 80's. This live version of MDNA is awesome, because it sounds completely different from the studio version. A must have for you Madonna collection!!!!
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: Another tour, another live album release.  Madonna and company have certainly realized the value in selling the audio portion of her concert films.  However, with each tour, it seems the allure of an audio-only version gets less and less.  MDNA World Tour (the live album) is disastrous.  I didn't think Madonna's camp could get any lazier in producing these.  This is nothing more than a straight audio rip of the Blu-ray/DVD release, complete with the intro sound effects (not part of the concert) and the camaraderie that's shown during the end credits.  No effort was made to optimize this for an audio-only format.  And worse yet, it seems no effort was made to optimize the sound mix either.  This album sounds like a cheap bootleg.At least the songs themselves (if you can stand the bad mastering) are pretty fantastic.  The album's best moments are those that are the least processed, such as "Candy Shop", "Express Yourself/Born This Way", the brief "Papa Don't Preach", "Love Spent" and "I'm a Sinner".  Plus, the cool arrangements  of "Hung Up", the afore-mentioned "Candy Shop" and "Open Your Heart" are definitely worthy of repeated listens.The MDNA Tour itself was downright flawless, so it's a shame we got such a low-quality recording.  I'd tell you to check out the Blu-ray/DVD instead, but the defects in this audio version seem to be magnified greatly on that package with horrible video quality and a flat-out defective audio track...but that's another review.  Buy this album if you must, just don't expect the best quality.  They should've gotten the guy who mixed The Confessions Tour to do this one as well.
summary: A lazy, poorly done audio rip of a fantastic concert
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: First of all the sound. Terrible. It was like someone placed a microphone in front of the stage and recorded all audio. This is not what I'd call HD master audio. Loads of echoes, reverberation, lack of dynamics and bass.  Sounds like it was in Mono.  It seems like they had to bring down the whole audio for Madonna voice to be heard.I have never heard anything this bad before.  As bad as you hear it from your TV speakers.  I was shocked.PLEASE DO NOT buy this concert.  I am trying to get my money back.
summary: The audio is just horrible.  Do NOT buy this Blu-ray
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: By far this is Madonna's most intense and cathartic tour yet. She was a woman scorned and the first half revealed it. However, as usual Madonna' never perspires in negativity for long, instead the MDNA tour is a spiritual ride, a reflection of the world and love, something to fight to live for. This woman amazes me every single time and I love it. No one will ever amount to the QUEEN of Pop Music!!!

Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: This is the first, full, un-adulterated recording of Madonna live! The MDNA tour isn't by any stretch the best show the Queen of Pop has ever taken on the road, but if there has been an event that has defined her career up to this point, this particular tour does that nicely. Featuring mostly tracks from her most current album, it still features some of her contemporary greatest hits. This is a masterfully arranged live album edit that fans will enjoy! If you couldn't get a ticket for the sold out event this is your chance!

reviewText: UPDATE 9/14/2013 CHANED FROM 5 TO 1 STAR DUE TO DEFECTIVE PRODUCT - STILL A GREAT SHOW THOUGH :/ UPDATE 09/11/2013  It's a shame that the quality of the blu-ray encoding is not that great. reviewText: With humility, I confess that I have had the good luck of being able to attend multiple concerts.  Madonna's 2012 tour stop in the Washington D.C. area was one of them, and I would easily rate her live performance as one of the top three best concerts (that I attended).  "Madonna's MDN World Tour" dvd is a continuation of the musical intensity and energy she puts out to give fans of her music an exhilarating show.  She creatively opens the show with various dancers dressed in red robes and eloquently closes with an energetic rendition of "Celebration".  Additionally, I found it heartwarming when Madonna took the time after "Open Your Heart" to thank her fans.  "I Don't Give A", "Express Yourself", "Vogue", "Erotic Candy Shop", and "Human Nature" are some of my favorite performances from this dvd. However, the following is the complete concert track listing for those who prefer more information on the songs that were performed (in sequential order): Virgin Mary (Intro), Girl Gone Wild, Revolver, Gang Bang, Papa Don't Preach, Hung Up, I Don't Give A, Best Friend, Express Yourself, Give Me All Your Luvin, Turn Up The Radio, Open Your Heart, Masterpiece, Justify My Love, Vogue, Erotic Candy Shop, Human Nature, Like A Virgin, Love Spent, Nobody Knows Me, I'm Addicted, I'm A Sinner, Like A Prayer, and Celebration.
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: Gutted after waiting so long for this (one of Madonna's best ever tours finally available to watch at home) - but I seem to have one of the defective Blu Rays.  Picture looks like an old analogue TV broadcast where the reception was bad. The Blue Ray of this concert is appalling, it is missing audio tracks, so the sound quality is totally terrible, the image is grainy and inferior, something has gone wrong in the duplication of this Blue Ray - Blue Ray is meant to be sharp, crisp, vivid and HD this one looks and sounds worse than an old VHS video copy of a copy.The tour was amazing, I made it to the pit, I was looking forward to the first Blue Ray of a Madonna concert, the blue rays have been recalled in other countries but not in the US, Live Nation and Universal know there is a problem.A very bad quality Blue Ray, alas I think the other 5 star reviews were made before they actually saw the Blue Ray and they were reviewing the original tour or the webcast of it NOT the blue ray.DO not buy the Blue Ray until they reissue a fixed version, it is an utter waste of money.
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: The top grossing tour of 2012 hits Blu-Ray at last. There's a reason Madonna is the undisputed Queen of Pop. The top selling female artist of all time knows how to put on a show. The Blu-Ray perfectly captures the enormous production that is the MDNA tour. The audio quality is top notch and the visuals are stunning. The editing is perfect and really gives a viewer the sense that they are the show. The MDNA Tour is a spectacle and this Blu-Ray is the perfect companion piece.
summary: Stunning Blu-Ray For a Stunning Show
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: I just received my Blu-ray of this concert.  I was lucky enough to watch the MDNA Tour on a windy/wet day in New York City NY last fall.  I also watched the Epix broadcast of this concert when it was shown earlier this year.  Sorry to say but I have to agree with the other reviewers.  There is a serious audio issue with any of the audio formats: DTS MA 5.1, DTS MA 2.0 or DTS - no bass, center channel sounds OK, but left, right and surround channels are almost inaudible.  What a disappointment!  I hope Amazon lets me return this...
summary: I was hoping the other reviewers were wrong but I agree with them!

Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: Madonna's a bit past her salad days on the pop charts and althoughMDNAwasn't well received commercially or critically her live shows are still amongst the best out there.  With 30 years of hits to draw off of Madonna could easily go the "oldies" route but has steadfastly refused, instead reworking, reinventing, remaking, and remodeling older hits to bring them into the present, blending well with more recent and current tracks.  As witnessed during her Superbowl appearance she's fearless at changing things up musically and remaining au courant.  The changing economics for musicians means tours make the big money and albums are the loss leaders; unlike the way things were when Madonna started out.  With theMDNArelease as her excuse to tour she set out to pack stadiums across the globe as usual, mixing up new tracks with a smattering of her bigger hits and the "MDNA Tour" serves up quite a few biggies ("Papa Don't Preach", "Hung Up", "Express Yourself", "Open Your Heart", "Justify My Love"' "Vogue", "Human Nature", and "Like a Prayer") reworked to make them more contemporary.  If anything the live versions improve upon the studio versions ofMDNAgiving them more life and vitality.  And this is closer to a true "live" album as it's fairly clear there were minimal or no overdubs and tweaking to make sure everything sounds perfect.  Still you've got to give it up to a 55 year old mother who can pump the crowd up and pack the dance floor and Madonna's working it as hard as peers half her age.  Truthfully, Madonna's live shows are a visual experience so the audio doesn't really give you a sense of how exciting the concert was.  Likewise, breaking it up into individual tracks like you would on an iPod or iTunes makes it a bit jarring; it's more of a set piece to listen to from start to finish.  Individually the tracks are stunning but there's a certain sense that the frequency with which Madonna is releasing live recordings that she's buying more and more time to record a new studio album.  That said, the "MDNA Tour" is a nice reminder that Madonna is still relevant and breaking new ground as an artist.Now to address some of the complaints in other reviews about the mix and the sound quality, which has been described as tinny, brassy, shrill, distorted or thin, especially when compared to bootleg copies.  The first question I would ask is whether these reviewers went to the concert or not, and if they boughtMDNAor not.  Madonna is making more use of auto-tuning on some tracks and as a result the mix on those tracks has to be altered otherwise the vocals are drowned out by the backing music.  This is just the shift and change in modern music and what Madonna's doing.  I heard the same complaints onThe Confessions Tour - Live from London (CD+DVD)when it came out in 2007 and truthfully it sounded pretty close to what the concert sounded like and that's the same case here.  This isn't the Madonna of the Blonde Ambition Tour circa 1990 and quite honestly this has been a frequent complaint related to not only Madonna's live recordings, but her studio work, and especially her singles mixes.  This isn't an apologia but an acknowledgement that music changes and evolves...the current trend is towards heavier treble and lighter base, which I might point out, sounds better on iPods which most people will be listening to this on.  Coincidence, brilliance, or just plain smart?  Knowing it's Madonna I can tell you it's NOT a coincidence!
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: I see her with different eyes. It's official; Madonna's time has come and I do not mean this in a bad way. Evolution is a part of life in every sense of the word. I only watched a few segments of this tour and I cut it off. For one, I'm bored and restless with her performing the exact same songs every single tour. Does this not get old to anyone except me? Madonna's songs are great but you can pretty much list the songs in your head that she will perform every show; Whether it be a tour or guest appearance she will perform those same 8 songs until she dies.Being that Madonna is not a vocalist there's only so much she can do with the same 10 songs; I'm bored. It's not like she's a powerhouse vocalist who hits different notes every tour so the songs arent interesting, especially when you listen to Madonna all year round (like I do), The newer performances can only be subpar at this point due to so many factors like age, attitude, energy etc.Watching Madonna in her 20's and 30's; She was raunchy, hip, glamorous and chic. Even in her 40's she still made her mark. Watching her at this age; She still looks good but the meaning has changed. I look.at her as a woman who has exhaled and enjoys entertaining and living in the moment versus getting on stage and dominating a show to prove something with attitude and glamour. She's past this part of her life and she should be. You can tell, the mood is different. She's a 55 yearold Mom having fun on stage like the old days.Madonna has nothing to prove anymore;Therefore, the routine is not a show anymorw. Its like when the cayote finally catches the roadrunner after decades of trying. Do you still watch it the same way? If new episodes are made it would seem fake and/or "staged".As Ive mentioned earlier, I listen to and watch the best parts of Madonna all year round; so to see or listen to her perform as an older woman it's not the same but I do respect it being that she's fortunate enough to still be making music and being healthy enough to perform. Its s beautiful life, and great to see her happy.Another major issue with Miss Madonna is that she hasn't created any music within the last 2 albums or in the last decade that she can age with. Especially this last album, all of her music as of late is a wreck and is immature which is why she only can perform the same restless 7 or 10 songs every concert because she's too mature to perform anything thats in sync with her age.Madonna is a beautiful woman and I adore her but I am not a sheep, and I think Madonna is only an outter shell of who she used to be and its her own fault. Listen to the last 2 albums, how can she grow or put on a decent show with songs like that? Overall the MDNA tour is respectable but its not something I would watch again. I also didnt hear anything live that I would want to make into an mp3.It's scary to know that all of the popstars today will be making party/bratty songs until they're in their 50's (Rihanna and Britney) are the first to come to.mind. Being that Madonna was the first popstar of her kind in the 80's and 90's, noone knew what an older Madonna or "like" popstars would be like at the age of 50. Madonna, Prince, Janet & Michael were the first generation to actually spice it up and take it to pop to a raunchier level; the world didnt see age when it came to these four iconic legends, but now its 2013 and we now see that those people do in fact age. They arent immortal beings as we subconsciously believed. Now we have an entire generation of followers if these legends. Janet was smart, she went into.hiding lol.The point is that things would be different had Madonna steered her own ship instead of still trying to be cool and please everyone else by going the gimmick route. Had she recorded music that showcases where her mind and soul are today it would be something to be proud of but in my book its not. Madonna and my mother are the exact same age, Madonna looks like my mothers friends on stage jumping around singing these young and hip songs. I would love to see Madonna actually be more creative. Her older hits are her only leg to stand on and.... I wont go any further this review is getting too long.Was it good? For a 55 yearold Madonna, yes. In general? It was basic, I used to look at Madonna wanting to be like her; now I just look at her. I feel like Im watching a show for old people on a crew ship. Like Dancing with stars at bingo night. Madonna will always be my girl but after seeing this tour I can't watch her do this for another tour. That'll be when she's 60 with another party album; I cant, its embarrassing, but who am I? Do what makes YOU happy.Update: 9/12/2013, Wow, I see my copy's defects are not due to it's edition according to the reviews.
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: I was so excited that Madonna was finally releasing an official entire  concert on CD. Did not expect the CD to sound like concert studio versions with a canned audience and Madonna's live vocals mixed poorly. I'm listening to this album as I write this, and I am stunned how awful the sound quality is.This release sucks all the energy out of the live performances. This becomes clearly evident by the first bars of the opener "Girl Gone Wild", The music sounds flat and Madonna's voice is mixed in a way to suggest she singing over a cheap karaoke machine. The sound improves marginally during the the super short version of "Papa Don't Preach" but as soon as "Hung Up" starts the sound flatlines again. "Like A Prayer" is completely ruined by the flat sound and the awful audience participation. There are a few tracks that manage to capture some of the magic i.e. Vogue, Justify My Love otherwise this is the most disappointing Madonna audio release in her 30+ year career. I'm well aware that this is a direct rip from the concert audio (which I don't have a problem with)but the lazy editing lets on well after the "Celebration" finale and you're left listening to random backstage noise until Madonna says "that's it ,let's go home". This release is strictly for the eyes and not the ears, meaning just get the DVD (apparently the blu-ray is having major sound issues).This album sounds like a bootleg that you would you get from one of those unofficial Madonna sites not an official release. Madonna fans deserve better from BoyToy Inc. and Live Nation.
summary: It's True the Sound is Awful and Lazy Editing
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour

reviewText: I do hope the sycophants who wrote glowing reviews on this page for this concert were paid like the ones featured in the mosh pit on this concert DVD!  Otherwise, our society is in far greater peril than the enlightened ones previously thought!  This is a very noisy, over-produced, choppy mesh of a concert.  It was dark, creepy, almost eerily icky in nature--like watching an aging Moulin Rouge tart cavorting about with youngsters in some creepy Stephen King horror concert movie. (Almost camp, like the Rocky Horror Picture Show.)  There are a few very good dance numbers in a couple of presentations, and one must credit Madonna for staying in shape and keeping at it, but as far as an entertaining, fun and light-spirited concert event goes, forget it.  Not at all a light-hearted fun filled event like the Confessions Tour, this concert was just a slick mess of noisy over-produced lip-synched electronic schlock.  Sad to think Madonna has come to this level of desperation.
summary: It's Like a Bad Moulin Rouge Camp Revue
Title: Madonna: The MDNA Tour
